Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2008 12:49PM Lindaip wrote: I was told by my oncologist in 2002 that with surgery only, I would have a 70% chance of recurrence. With each therapy, (4 A/C, 4 Taxotere and 5 years of Arimidex) my chances of reccurrence would go down. I calculated it out to about 17.5%. That was six years ago and I now have NED. I am also on a clinical trial to see if 5 years of Femara (I am either getting Femara or a placebo) brings the recurrence rate down even more. Also remember that the informationÂ on recurrence rates is 5 years old and women are doing muuch better now than those rates show. Linda

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2009 10:24PM Lindaip wrote: When I had a prothesis, I wanted to wear a swimsuit so I took a bra that fit well and sewed in a prothesis that I had purchased from TLC. It was stitched around the edges. The suit was a tankini and covered the bra well.
